thread.title: David Wright sent back to New York due to shoulder soreness
thread.title_full: David Wright sent back to New York due to shoulder soreness - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: David Wright sent back to New York due to shoulder soreness
text:
The David Wright comeback has hit its first roadblock.
The Mets third baseman is leaving Port St. Lucie and returning to New York to meet with team doctors due to an impingement in his right shoulder. There is no structural damage, and surgery isn’t expected, but Wright can’t throw a baseball.
Mets general manager Sandy Alderson said that Wright is questionable for Opening Day.
THIS IS A DEVELOPING STORY. CHECK BACK FOR UPDATES
